thread.title: Peterson: Illness not from chewing tobacco
thread.title_full: Peterson: Illness not from chewing tobacco

author: Jarrett Bell, USA TODAY Sports
title: Peterson: Illness not from chewing tobacco
text:
Peterson: Illness not from chewing tobacco USA Today Sports 1 hr ago by Jarrett Bell, USA TODAY Sports © Tim Fuller, USA TODAY Sports Peterson: Illness not from chewing tobacco DETROIT – Adrian Peterson insists that it was “bad shrimp” and not a case where, as widely reported, he swallowed chewing tobacco that upset his stomach during the Vikings’ chartered team flight to Detroit on Saturday.
AdChoices As the Minnesota Vikings’ star running back explained this at his locker following a 28-19 win against the Lions, he surely looked the part – with a wad of tobacco lodged between his chin and gum.
“Anybody that knows me, they know that swallowing this is not going to hurt your stomach,” Peterson said. “Because you’re used to it. So I don’t know where that came from.”
In any event, Peterson was affected more by the Lions defense than by any lingering effects from the episode with his stomach.
With the exception of a 75-yard jaunt in the third quarter, the Lions contained Peterson, allowing him just 23 yards on the 18 carries beyond his big run.
And even on the long run, Detroit forced Minnesota to settle for a field goal as Ziggy Ansah caught up with Peterson before he could cross the goal line.
“I take my hat off to him,” Peterson said of Ansah. “I got tackled at the 3-yard line.”
After the game, Peterson searched for Ansah but couldn’t find him as players mingled on the field.
“Because that effort he put in, not to give up on a play, it saved a touchdown,” Peterson said, “and kept their hopes of coming back alive.”
